channel.title: Comments on: Monday Go Meditation: Game 39

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Well said! I'm also trying to be more patient about the usefulness of my thickness too. I think at the weaker ranks, it's more common to try and utilize it immediately.
item.content:encoded: Well said! I’m also trying to be more patient about the usefulness of my thickness too. I think at the weaker ranks, it’s more common to try and utilize it immediately.

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: I'm not claiming to be great at it, but learning to feel the strength of solidity, thickness, and influence like this is one of the chief parts of getting stronger. When I was weaker, I never liked these abstract moves - I wanted value! Territory! But as I learned to just *wait* for the power of moves like this to manifest themselves, I found myself having many games where the latter half of the game was fun for me, where it was my opponent who had to jump in to difficult fights and fight for their life. And as that fighting created disadvantageous exchanges, I would watch in amazement as territory materialized.
item.content:encoded: I’m not claiming to be great at it, but learning to feel the strength of solidity, thickness, and influence like this is one of the chief parts of getting stronger. When I was weaker, I never liked these abstract moves – I wanted value! Territory! But as I learned to just *wait* for the power of moves like this to manifest themselves, I found myself having many games where the latter half of the game was fun for me, where it was my opponent who had to jump in to difficult fights and fight for their life. And as that fighting created disadvantageous exchanges, I would watch in amazement as territory materialized.

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: First: it's expanding along the fourth line, the line of victory. Second: it's reaching out ahead of white toward the top, where black has tons of potential. Third: if you doubt that it's sente, imagine the most obvious followup move, at P9. THAT'S a move where the feeling of power is unmistakable.
item.content:encoded: First: it’s expanding along the fourth line, the line of victory. Second: it’s reaching out ahead of white toward the top, where black has tons of potential. Third: if you doubt that it’s sente, imagine the most obvious followup move, at P9. THAT’S a move where the feeling of power is unmistakable.

item.title: By: Tilwen

item.description: Maybe I'll ask him if we meet. Anyway, that post was really nice, you're doing a great job :) . We should play some day, I bet it would be close from even :)

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I think it has to do with the stability of the group and the future impact on the rest of the board. And if you have further questions, frozensoul was the one who mentioned it, so be sure to get in touch with him!
item.content:encoded: I think it has to do with the stability of the group and the future impact on the rest of the board. And if you have further questions, frozensoul was the one who mentioned it, so be sure to get in touch with him!

item.title: By: Tilwen

item.description: Wow, why would be R9 the biggest move on board ? Can't feel this :)
